perturbation.original_text: Each of the foregoing parties is referred to herein as a "Party" and together as the "Parties". RECITALS A. Recipient wishes to engage the Provider to provide certain services and resources (the "Services") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the foregoing parties is referred to herein as a "Party" and together as the "Parties". RECITALS A. Recipient wishes to engage the Vendor to provide certain services and resources (the "Deliverables") and Provider desires to provide Recipient with the Services all in accordance with the terms and conditions set forth herein.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Provider' is replaced with 'Vendor' and 'Services' with 'Deliverables' in the Recitals section, creating uncertainty. While 'Provider' and 'Services' are defined terms later in the agreement, using 'Vendor' and 'Deliverables' here introduces an inconsistency, and it remains unclear whether the 'Vendor' is the same as the 'Provider' defined later.

perturbation.original_text: Provider shall maintain complete and accurate records relating to the provision of the Services under this Agreement, in such form as Recipient shall approve.
perturbation.changed_text: Supplier shall maintain complete and accurate records relating to the provision of the Services under this Agreement, in such form as Recipient shall approve.
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Provider' is replaced with 'Supplier'. This creates confusion as to whether 'Supplier' and 'Provider' refer to the same entity. The agreement does not define 'Supplier', so it is unclear if the obligations placed upon the 'Provider' also apply to the 'Supplier'.

perturbation.original_text: During the term of this Agreement and thereafter, the Parties hereto shall, and shall instruct their respective representatives to, maintain in confidence and not disclose the other Party's financial, technical, sales, marketing, development, personnel, and other information, records, or data, including, without limitation, customer lists, supplier lists, trade secrets, designs, product formulations, product specifications or any other proprietary or confidential information, however recorded or preserved, whether written or oral (any such information, "Confidential Information").
perturbation.changed_text: During the term of this Agreement and thereafter, the Signatories hereto shall, and shall instruct their respective representatives to, maintain in confidence and not disclose the other Signatory's financial, technical, sales, marketing, development, personnel, and other information, records, or data, including, without limitation, customer lists, vendor lists, trade secrets, designs, product formulations, product specifications or any other proprietary or confidential information, however recorded or preserved, whether written or oral (any such information, "Proprietary Information").
perturbation.explanation: The term 'Parties' is replaced with 'Signatories,' and 'Confidential Information' is replaced with 'Proprietary Information.' This creates ambiguity because the contract defines 'Parties' and 'Confidential Information' explicitly, but it never defines 'Signatories' or 'Proprietary Information'. It is unclear whether the obligations pertaining to confidentiality apply in the same way to the potentially broader scope of 'Proprietary Information.'
